title: Bring Down the Exponential
text: Take the logarithm of both sides
speech: Take the logarithm of both sides
pacedSpeech: Take the logarithm of both sides

title: Apply Log Rule
text: We know that $$n*\log_{a}\left(b\right)=\log_{a}\left(b^n\right)$$. After taking log both sides, the left expression will be $$\log_{10}\left(7^x\right)=x*\log_{10}\left(7\right)$$.
speech: We know that  n times the log base a of b is equal to the log base a of, parentheses b to the n-th  . After taking log both sides, the left expression will be  the log base 10 of, parentheses 7 to the x-th  is equal to, x times the log base 10 of 7 .

. After taking log both sides, the left expression will be   the log base 10 of,  7 to the x-th  is equal to, x times the log base 10 of 7

title: Solve for $$x$$ in New Equation
text: $$x*\log_{10}\left(7\right)=\log_{10}\left(43\right)$$ We can solve for $$x$$ and get $$x=(\log_{10}\left(43\right))/(\log_{10}\left(7\right))$$ which approximatly equal to $$1.933$$.
